title: Fed Governor Bowman Says US Banking System Remains ‘Resilient’
description: Michelle Bowman, governor of the U.S. Federal Reserve, speaks during a Fed Listens event on "Perspectives on Maximum Employment and Price Stability" at the Federal Reserve in Washington, D.C., U.S., on Friday, Oct. 4, 2019. Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell said that the U.S. economy is in a good place though it faces some risks.

title: Hunt to Extend Free Child Care in UK Budget to Boost Labor Force
description: UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Jeremy Hunt plans to unveil a multi-billion pound expansion of free child care in his budget on Wednesday as he seeks to get parents back into work, a senior official said.

title: Norfolk Southern Sued by Ohio Over Toxic Train Derailment
description: Ohio sued rail operator Norfolk Southern Corp. over a derailment that spilled toxic chemicals last month in the town of East Palestine.

title: Senator Brown Urges Fed to Tighten Bank Regulations, Pause Rate Hikes
description: Senate Banking Chairman Sherrod Brown said Tuesday he sees little chance Congress will tighten bank regulations following the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank and Signature Bank, and is urging the Federal Reserve to act unilaterally to impose tougher regulations and pause interest rate hikes.

title: Russian Fighter Aircraft Collides With US Drone Above Black Sea
description: A Russian fighter jet collided with a US surveillance drone in international airspace above the Black Sea, forcing the unmanned aircraft to crash, the US said.

title: UK Fuel Truck Drivers Vote to Strike From Late March Over Pay
description: Some tanker drivers are set to strike in late March, disrupting supply of fuels to a chain of filling stations owned by Phillips 66, according to the Unite union.

title: SVB Failure Sparks UK Rush to Scrub ‘Silicon Valley’ From Budget
description: The collapse of Silicon Valley Bank has ignited a debate within the UK government over whether to include the words “Silicon Valley” in its budget statement on Wednesday.

title: Hunt Has Limited Room for Maneuver on UK Budget
description: UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Jeremy Hunt delivers his first budget on Wednesday, setting out tax-and-spend policies for the last full year before the next election.

title: The US Is Now Taking Applications to Run Public EV Chargers
description: Two grant programs will dole out $2.5 billion over the next five years to build EV chargers in publicly accessible places and along highways.

title: George Santos Files Paperwork for 2024 Reelection Bid
description: Representative George Santos filed paperwork Tuesday declaring his intention to seek reelection in 2024, even as he fights off an ethics investigation into myriad lies about his background and experience.

title: Hunt Considers Limiting UK Energy Profits Tax When Prices Fall
description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Jeremy Hunt is considering limiting the windfall tax on the profits of UK oil and gas companies to allay industry concerns.

title: Top Pharmacies Pressed on Abortion Pill Plans by Senate Democrats
description: Lawmakers say companies may be exacerbating confusion among consumers

title: Scholz Tells Germans Not to Worry About Savings After SVB Crash
description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz said Germans shouldn’t be worried about their savings following the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank as regulators improved oversight since the last global financial crisis.

title: Americanas Executives, Brazil Central Bank Chief Asked to Testify in Congress
description: A Brazilian Senate committee on Tuesday extended formal invitations to central bank chief Roberto Campos Neto and five former executives from beleaguered retailer Americanas SA, asking them to provide details on a pair of sagas that have gripped the country in the opening months of Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s presidency.

title: DUP Seeks Changes to UK-EU Deal on N. Ireland Trade After Brexit
description: Democratic Unionist Party leader Jeffrey Donaldson called for “clarification, re-working and change” to parts of the Windsor agreement between the UK and the European Union on Northern Ireland’s post-Brexit arrangements.

title: Norway to Buy 6 Seahawk Helicopters to Boost Naval Defense
description: Norway’s government decided to buy 6 maritime helicopters produced by Lockheed Martin Corp. to strengthen the Nordic country’s border defenses and its presence in the High North.

title: Hungary to Delay NATO Enlargement Vote, Opposition Lawmaker Says
description: Hungary has once again delayed a vote on NATO enlargement after Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s deputy scrapped legislative sessions for next week, according to an opposition lawmaker.

title: EU Seeks to Reduce Energy Costs in Bid for Competitiveness
description: The European Union aims to prevent excessive swings in energy prices with a reform of its electricity market, its energy chief said, part of a broader plan to bolster competitiveness while shifting to a greener economy.

title: Saudi Arabia Plans to Buy Up to 121 Boeing 787 Dreamliners
description: Saudi Arabia plans to buy as many as 121 Boeing Co. 787 Dreamliners, as Crown Prince Mohammed Bin Salman builds a new international airline intended to rival regional carriers Emirates and Qatar Airways, according to a Commerce Department statement that has since been removed.

title: SVB Failure Gives California Senate Contenders a Chance to Bash Banks
description: Adam Schiff wants to go after banker pay for failed lenders.

title: Warren Calls on Powell to Recuse Himself From Fed’s SVB Review
description: Senator Elizabeth Warren called on Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell to recuse himself from the Fed’s review of the failure of the Silicon Valley Bank, the biggest collapse of a lender in more than a decade.

title: Poland May Transfer MiG-29s to Ukraine in Weeks, Premier Says
description: Poland may send Soviet-era MiG-29 fighter jets to Ukraine in four to six weeks, Prime Minister Mateusz Morawiecki told reporters on Tuesday without elaborating on the size of the contingent.

title: Thai Premier Clears Multi-Billion Spending Plan as Vote Nears
description: Thailand’s cabinet approved a raft of proposals in what’s likely to be its last meeting before Prime Minister Prayuth Chan-Ocha dissolves parliament to pave way for a general election.

title: South Africa Has Plans in Place to Safeguard Food Supply Amid Power Crisis
description: South Africa’s government has contingency plans in place to safeguard key food-production facilities against an escalation in power cuts that are already at record levels, the nation’s agriculture minister said.

title: Imran Khan Supporters Clash With Police Out to Arrest Him
description: Imran Khan’s supporters clashed with police outside the former Pakistan premier’s home in central Lahore city as the security officials tried to arrest Khan for the second time.

title: Brainard Must Help Contain SVB Crisis She Warned Was Coming
description: Lael Brainard, as a US Federal Reserve governor, repeatedly warned that efforts to deregulate banks were a recipe for disaster.

title: UN Seizes on Iran-Saudi Detente to Push For End to Yemen War
description: A top United Nations envoy visited Iran to discuss ending the war in Yemen, days after the Islamic Republic and Saudi Arabia agreed to restore ties and curtail a rivalry that’s fueled the conflict for almost a decade.

title: Germany Makes Last-Minute Demands Over Reform of EU Fiscal Rules
description: Germany has made last-minute demands over planned revisions to the European Union’s fiscal rules governing public debt and deficits in a fresh setback that underlines how the bloc’s biggest economy has become an unpredictable negotiating partner.

title: Xi Jinping Seeks a New Role — Global Peacemaker
description: Xi Jinping is playing peacemaker in the Middle East. Next up: Russia and Ukraine.

title: India Offers Taliban Officials a Course in Economics, Leadership
description: India will include Taliban officials in a crash course on its culture, legislation and business climate, underscoring New Delhi’s continued interest in staying engaged with Afghanistan’s new government.

title: President Sall Is Risking Senegal Stability as Gas Boom Nears, Rival Says
description: As Senegal readies for an oil and gas boom, President Macky Sall is putting the country’s stability at risk by refusing to rule out running for a third term, according to his main political challenger.

title: Macron’s Reformist Legacy Tested as Pension Bill Reaches Endgame
description: Emmanuel Macron faces parliamentary brinkmanship and protests this week over his plan to raise the retirement age, with the potential for a politically bruising outcome that would shape the French president’s capacity to keep pushing a pro-business agenda.

title: A Warmer Arctic Challenges Troops Training for Subzero Warfare
description: Jammed guns and refreezing runways are among the problems facing military forces that train in the Arctic, where climate change is causing temperatures to rise and fluctuate more dramatically.

title: Xi Reboots Statesman Image in Push to Counter US on World Stage
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping is rebooting his image as a global statesman — and he’s already got a significant win under his belt.

title: A New Court Ringmaster Is Set to Oversee Trump Grand Juries in Washington
description: When Judge James Boasberg is sworn in Friday as the new chief judge of the US District Court in Washington, he’ll suddenly be at the epicenter of federal investigations circling former President Donald Trump.

title: Biden to Issue Executive Order Enforcing Gun Background Checks
description: President Joe Biden will announce a new executive order intended to reduce gun violence on Tuesday during a visit to the location of the mass shooting in Monterey Park, California, in January, according to a senior administration official.

title: Turkey May Not Need Russia’s S-400 Missile Defense, Manufacturer Says
description: Turkey might not need Russian S-400 batteries in order to protect itself as its homegrown equipment increasingly takes on that role, a major Turkish manufacturer said in comments likely to be welcomed by Washington.

title: Free IRS TurboTax Competitor Is Closer After Biden Funding
description: Intuit has warned investors for decades about the potential threat from government-funded software.

title: Rheinmetall Says Europe Must Double Shell Production for Ukraine
description: Rheinmetall AG, Germany’s largest munitions manufacturer, said Europe’s defense industry can’t meet Ukraine’s artillery ammunition needs for its war against Russia unless governments increase spending enough to double production capacity.

title: Chinese Military Doctor Who Was SARS Whistleblower Dies at 91
description: BEIJING (AP) — Jiang Yanyong, a Chinese military doctor who revealed the full extent of the 2003 SARS outbreak and was later placed under house arrest for his political outspokenness, has died, a long-time acquaintance and a Hong Kong newspaper said Tuesday.

title: Plan to Allow 69-Hour Work Week Upsets Gen Zs, Millennials in South Korea
description: South Korea will reconsider its plan to raise the maximum weekly work hours to 69 after its “MZ Generation” of millennials and Generation Z members balked at the idea many saw as destroying a healthy work-life balance.

title: Ukraine Latest: Key Republican Assails US Policy in Ukraine
description: Ron DeSantis, the governor of Florida and likely Republican presidential candidate, voiced misgivings over US support for Ukraine, breaking with the Biden administration.

title: US Urges Turkey to Allow NATO Expansion As Officials Set to Meet
description: US National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan urged Turkey to ratify membership of Sweden and Finland into NATO, speaking ahead of talks with his Turkish counterpart in Washington on Tuesday.

title: Work Just Doesn’t Pay for Thousands of People in Sunak’s Britain
description: Saira Hussein almost decided to give up hiring an assistant when one candidate said all he wanted from her was to sign a form so he could keep drawing benefits.

title: Biden Says Striking Down Student Debt Relief Would Be ‘Short-Sighted’
description: President Joe Biden expressed assurance in the viability of his student debt cancellation plan during a late-night television interview on Monday, a reversal from his previous comments that suggested the US Supreme Court could strike it down.

title: US Treasury to Allow GOP Glimpses of Biden Banking Documents
description: The US Treasury Department is set to allow House Republicans to inspect reports on foreign banking and other business transactions by relatives and associates of President Joe Biden, including his son Hunter Biden.

title: Japan to Treat South Korean Leader to Omelette Rice, Report Says
description: Japan is going the extra mile to welcome South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol to Tokyo with one of his favorite dishes — “omurice,” or fried rice topped with an omelette, according to local media.

title: Former Congresswoman Pat Schroeder, Pioneer for Women's Rights, Dies at 82
description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Former U.S. Rep. Pat Schroeder, a pioneer for women’s and family rights in Congress, died Monday night. She was 82.

title: Ship With No Permit Causes ‘Nightmare’ Philippine Oil Spill
description: The Philippines is grappling with the fallout of an oil spill south of Manila, with a contractor describing the cleanup as a “logistical nightmare” amid questions on why the ship carrying industrial fuel was able to sail without a permit.

title: DeSantis Assails US Policy in Ukraine, Breaking With Much of GOP
description: Ron DeSantis on Monday expressed strong misgivings over US support for Ukraine in its defense against Russia’s invasion, breaking not only with the Biden administration but other prominent Republicans.

title: Japan Weighs Defense Exports as It Shows Off Fighter Jet Plans
description: Japan’s joint fighter jet project with the UK and Italy will take center stage at a defense show near Tokyo this week, as the country bolsters its defense ties with NATO members and mulls loosening controls on defense exports.

title: There's One International Soccer Tournament Where Russia Is Invited to Play
description: SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — Russia has been invited to participate in the inaugural Central Asian Football Association Championships in June along with seven other national teams.

title: Freeland Meets With Canada’s Bank Regulator After SVB Collapse
description: Finance Minister Chrystia Freeland met with the head of Canada’s bank regulator in the wake of a US regional bank collapse, with her office emphasizing that domestic institutions are secure.

title: Hunt Can Unleash £50 Billion Investment With Tax Relief, Says CBI
description: One of the UK’s leading business groups urged the government to bring in a new tax deduction system to boost private sector investment and drive greater economic growth.
